comments:
It looks like the method assumes new contents have been received from the
server if no server error occurs.  We should check to ensure that we
actually did receive contents.  May be worth investigating why the error
was not caught.  The problem occurred after moving a folder with some
contents, then synchronizing.

I've added an exception that will give more information.

We haven't seen this one since. If it occurs again, we should raise a new PR 
with the new exception message

We fixed this by adding a check for null in RemoteFile.getContents()
and throwing a CVSException.  We should watch out for those instead
since they might signal weird server errors we are not already
generating CVSServerExceptions for.
